syndrome_features: Skeletal dysplasia, severe brachydactyly, midfacial hypoplasia and intellectual disability

syndrome_name: Autosomal dominant nocturnal frontal lobe epilepsy

syndrome_features: Focal seizures with auditory features as the most common ictal phenomena
syndrome_name: Autosomal dominant partial epilepsy with auditory features

syndrome_features: Reduced activity of adenylosuccinate lyase, intellectual disability, autism, epilepsy
Arrested psychomotor development, hypotonia, seizures, and global cerebral hypomyelination.
Developmental delay, subacute encephalopathy, irritability, sterile pyrexia, intracranial calcifications
Alternating hemiplegia
Intellectual disability
Alopecia of scalp, absence of facial and body hair, mild to severe intellectual disability.
Cerebellar ataxia, dysarthria, abnormal eye movements
Anemia (alpha-thalassemia), hypotonia, intellectual disability, dysmorphic features including hypertelorism, tented upper lip, coarsening of facial features

Macrocephaly, hypoplastic midface, dysplastic ears, hypertelorism, down-slanting palpebral fissures, optic/retinal abnormalities, nystagmus, polydactyly (pre- and post-axial), bifid phalanges of thumbs, duplicated halluces, mental retardation, seizures
Agenesis of the corpus callosum, mental retardation, infantile spasms, chorioretinal lacunae.
Severe congenital microcephaly

Elongated facies, facial asymmetry, hypertelorism, protruding tongue, progressive distal and proximal limb weakness with denervation on EMG, mild to severe mental retardation, agenesis of the corpus callosum
syndrome_synonyms: Agenesis of the corpus callosum with peripheral neuropathy, Charlevoix Disease

syndrome_features: Intellectual disability, postnatal microcephaly, inappropriate laughter, epilepsy
Acrocephalosyndactyly, acrobrachycephaly, coronal craniosynostosis, symmetric osseous and/or cutaneous syndactyly of hands and feet, broad thumbs and great toes

A spectrum of ocular anomalies that includes prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe, attached strands of peripheral iris, displaced pupils, atypical coloboma, polycoria. Increased risk of glaucoma. Facial dysmorphism includes maxillary hypoplasia, receding chin, and hypodontia.
Intellectual disability, obesity, epilepsy
Generalized or focal seizures starting around postnatal day three and spontaneously remitting within the first month of life
Choreathetosis, thyroid dysfunction, respiratory distress
Short stature, facial dysmorphology (hypertelorism, epicanthal folds), ptosis, colobomata, CNS migrational abnormalities, sensorineural hearing loss
Intellectual disability, rod-cone retinal dystrophy, truncal obesity, postaxial polydactyly, male hypogonadotrophic hypogonadism, complex female genitourinary malformations, and renal abnormalities.
Generalized overgrowth, including macrosomia, macroglossia, and visceromegaly. Neonatal presentation includes hypoglycemia and omphalocele. A variety of embryonal tumors may occur.
Complete or incomplete arhinia, variable abnormalities of the eyes, including microphthalmia
Nonprogressive cerebellar ataxia and intellectual disability
syndrome_name: Cerebellar ataxia, mental retardation, and dysequilibrium syndrome

syndrome_features: Cerebellar ataxia, areflexia, pes cavus, optic atrophy and sensorineural hearing loss
Hypoventilation in infancy, autonomic nervous system dysregulation, some have abnormalities of neural crest development including hirschsprung disease, tumors of neural crest origin
Severe  micrognathia, rib defects, and intellectual disability

syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type II

syndrome_features: Severe psychomotor delay, hypotonia, seizures, esotropia, failure to thrive, and progressive microcephaly
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type IIh

syndrome_features: Characteristic dysmorphism, intellectual disability, inverted nipples, abnormal subcutaneous fat distribution, and cerebellar hypoplasia
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type Ia

syndrome_features: Ataxia, intellectual disability, epilepsy
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type Ic

syndrome_features: Microcephaly (possibly postnatal), epilepsy, intellectual disability
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type Id

syndrome_features: Intellectual disability, microcephaly, epilepsy
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type Ie

syndrome_features: Intellectual disability, erythematous, scaley skin, attacks of hypertonia
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type If

syndrome_features: Dysmorphic facies, intellectual disability, postnatal microcephaly, impaired immunity and coagulation deficits
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type Ig

syndrome_features: Microcephaly, intellectual disability, epilepsy
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type Ij

syndrome_features: Severe developmental delay, intellectual disability, postnatal microcephaly, infant-onset epilepsy, nephrotic syndrome, liver dysfunction, coagulation abnormalities, cardiomyopathy, and immunodeficiency
syndrome_name: Congenital disorder of glycosylation type Ik

syndrome_features: Characteristic facial dysmorphology, prenatal growth restriction, microcephaly, intellectual disability, upper limb reduction defects
Microcephaly, neurologic impairment, characteristic facial dysmorphology, and palmoplantar keratoderma and late-onset ichthyosis.
syndrome_name: Cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis and keratoderma syndrome

syndrome_features: Cardiac anomalies (pulmonic stenosis and other valve dysplasias, septal defects, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, rhythm disturbances), cutaneous findings, distinctive hair, some intellectual disability
Chorea, occasionally Parkinsonism, myopathy, elevated CK, acanthocytosis
CHARGE stands for Coloboma, Heart defects, Atresia choanae, Retarded growth, Genital anomalies, and Ear anomalies.

Organ asymmetry often with hypoplasia on the side of ichthyosis and limb malformations. Organs affected can include lung, thyroid, psoas muscle, cranial nerves, brainstem, cerebellum, and spinal cord.
syndrome_synonyms: Ichthyosiform erythroderma, unilateral, with ipsilateral malformations, especially absence deformity of limbs

syndrome_features: Intellectual disability, epilepsy, thin body habitus, brain malformations.
COACH stands for Cerebellar vermis hypoplasia, Oligophrenia, Ataxia, ocular Coloboma, and Hepatic fibrosis.
syndrome_synonyms: A subtype of Joubert syndrome related disorders

syndrome_features: Intellectual disability, cataracts, aberrant dental cusp morphology and delayed eruption, malformations of the external ear, and spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia.
syndrome_synonyms: Cerebral, ocular, dental, auricular, and skeletal anomalies syndrome

syndrome_features: Microcephaly, arthrogryposis, facial dysmorphism (prominent nose, large ears, micrognathia), microphthalmia, scoliosis

A spectrum of findings encompassing congenital retinal blindness, polyscystic kidney disease, and cerebellar vermal hypoplasia (Dekaban-Arima Syndrome), congenital retinal blindness, nephronophthisis (Senior-Loken Syndrome)

Coarse facial features (including broad nasal bridge, wide mouth with full lips and macroglossia), macrocephaly, enlarged heart (increased ventricular mass, enlarged chambers, and normal cardiac function), hypertrichosis, and skeletal abnormalities (thickening of the calvaria, broad ribs, scoliosis, and flaring of the metaphyses).
Iris coloboma, anal atresia with fistula, facial dysmorphism (downslanting palpebral fissures, preauricular tags/pits)
syndrome_synonyms: Schmid-Fraccaro Syndrome, Partial Tetrasomy Chromosome 22 Syndrome, Coloboma of Iris-Anal Atresia Syndrome

syndrome_features: Sensorineural hearing loss, agenesis of the corpus callosum
Postnatal growth failure, including postnatal microcephaly, progressive central nervous system impairment
Intellectual disability, microcephaly, facial dysmorphism, cardiac anomalies, stimulus-induced drop attacks
Aplasia or hypoplasia of distal phalanx or nail of the fifth digit, dysmorphic facial features, intellectual disability.
Intellectual disability, postnatal microcephaly, truncal obesity, progressive retinal dystrophy

Failure to thrive, mental retardation, coarse facies, sparse/curly hair, loose skin with deep palmar and plantar creases, papillomata of the face/perianal region, cardiac valvular disease and cardiac rhythm disturbances.
Craniosynostosis, hypertelorism, exophthalmos, beaked nose, mandibular prognathism.
Craniosynostosis, acanthosis nigricans
Onset of hyperglycemia in the first 6 months of life that does not resolve, infant-onset epilepsy, failure to thrive

Mild DM1 is characterized by cataract and mild myotonia (sustained muscle contraction); life span is normal. Classic DM1 is characterized by muscle weakness and wasting, myotonia, cataract, and often cardiac conduction abnormalities; adults may become physically disabled and may have a shortened life span. Congenital DM1 is characterized by hypotonia and severe generalized weakness at birth, often with respiratory insufficiency and early death; intellectual disability is common.
Progressive spondyloepimetaphyseal dysplasia, short stature, intellectual disability
Proximal weakness, intellectual disability
Epilepsy, particularly early onset febrile status epilepticus, ataxia, developmental delay, intellectual disability
Spells of incoordination and imbalance, often associated with progressive ataxia.
Neurodegeneration, seizures, cutaneous abnormalities, systemic iron overload
Seizures arising from varied cortical regions
syndrome_name: Familial focal epilepsy with variable foci

syndrome_features: Mental retardation, congenital hypotonia, macrocephaly, imperforate anus
Severe neonatal and early infantile encephalopathy that is characterized by poor feeding, failure to thrive, hypotonia, lethargy, and seizures.
Craniofacial dysmorphology, ocular abnormalities, hearing loss, agenesis of the corpus callosum, intellectual disability, ophalocele, congenital diaphragmatic hernia
Involuntary movements (dystonia, chorea) precipitated by changes in movement
syndrome_synonyms: Paroxysmal kinesigenic choreoathetosis, paroxysmal kinesigenic dyskinesia

syndrome_features: Intellectual disability, autism, characteristic facies
Characteristic digital anomalies, microcephaly, facial dysmorphism, gastrointestinal anomalies
Characteristic dysmorphology, short stature, intellectual disability, skeletal anomalies
Cryptophthalmos, syndactyly, ambiguous genitalia, laryngeal, and genitourinary malformations, oral clefting and intellectual disability
Diaphragmatic defect (hernia, eventration, hypoplasia or agenesis), coarse facies, hypertelorism, distal digital hypoplasia
Anophthalmia/microphthalmia, bilateral cleft lip/cleft palate, facial clefting, abnormal ears
syndrome_synonyms: Microphthalmia with facial clefting, Anophthalmia-Plus Syndrome

syndrome_features: Severe hypotonia and generalized muscle weakness, cobblestone malformation, contractures of extremities, myopathic facies
A spectrum of epilepsy disorders that includes simple febrile seizures and generalized epilepsy with febrile seizures plus
syndrome_name: Generalized epilepsy with febrile seizures plus

syndrome_features: Infant-onset epilepsy, progressive microcephaly, and a variety of movement disorders
syndrome_synonyms: De Vivo disease, GLUT1 deficiency syndrome

syndrome_features: Nephrotic syndrome, microcephaly, intellectual disability
syndrome_synonyms: Microcephaly, hiatal hernia, and nephrotic syndrome; Nephrosis, neuronal dysmigration syndrome

syndrome_features: Presence for more than a year of multiple motor tics and at least one vocal tic.
Hirschsprung disease, generalized polymicrogyria
Hemifacial microsomia involving first and second branchial arch derivatives (ie eye, ear, palate), preauricular tags
syndrome_synonyms: Oculoauriculovertebral dysplasia or spectrum, facioauriculovertebral sequence

syndrome_features: Dermal defects (poikiloderma), papillomas of the mucous membranes or skin, digital anomalies, dental anomalies
Progressive chorea, cognitive decline, psychiatric disturbance
Dysmorphic facies (hypoplastic mandible, small beaked nose), microphthalmia, hypotrichosis, dwarfism
syndrome_synonyms: Francois Dyscephalic Syndrome, Oculomandibulodyscephaly with Hypotrichosis syndrome, Oculodentodigital dysplasia syndrome

syndrome_features: Generalized lymphatic dysplasia, facial dysmorphism, intellectual disability.
Developmental regression, hypotonia, and progressive spastic tetraparesis. Strabismus, nystagmus, optic atrophy and cerebellar atrophy are common.
Macular hypopigmented skin streaks and whorls.
Abnormal eye movements, neonatal disordered breathing (tachypnea, hyperpnea, central apnea), molar tooth malformation
Poor growth, intellectual disability, dysmorphic features (aplasia or hypoplasia of the nasal alae), abnormal hair pattern, abnormal teeth. Can have sensorineural hearing loss.
Intellectual disability, macrodontia of upper central incisors, facial dysmorphology, short stature, skeletal anomalies.
Severe developmental delay, intellectual disability, microcephaly, lipodystrophy, aged appearance.
Cutaneous hemangiomata with hypertrophy of underlying bone and soft tissue.
Short stature, mental retardation, long palpebral fissures with arched eyebrows, prominent ears, persistence of fetal fingerpads, 5th finger brachydactyly, vertebral deformity, hypogammaglobulinemia
Isolated GnRH deficiency and anosmia.

Intellectual disability, severe abnormality of speech development, microcephaly, hypotonia, and characteristic facial features (hypertelorism, synophrys, midface hypoplasia, protruding tongue, eversion of the lower lip, and prognathism.) Congenital heart defects and childhood obesity common.
Eye anomalies, occipital skull defects, ranging from occipital encephalocele to occult cutis aplasia
Juvenile-onset Parkinsonism,  supranuclear gaze palsy, spasticity, and dementia
syndrome_synonyms: Pallidopyramidal degeneration with supranuclear upgaze paresis and dementia

syndrome_features: Lympho-reticular malignancies, significant microcephaly, and radiation hypersensitivity.
Retinal dystrophy, Franceschetti sign, nystagmus
Unilateral or bilateral microphthalmia, malformations of the ears, teeth, fingers, skeleton, and/or genitourinary system.
Intellectual disability, delayed closure of fontanel, symphalangism, progressive skeletal sclerosis, growth restriction
Congenital cataracts, infantile glaucoma, hypotonia, intellectual disability
Macrocephaly, characteristic facies, severe hyperlaxity of skin, moderate to severe scoliosis with short stature
syndrome_name: Macrocephaly, alopecia, cutis laxa, and scoliosis syndrome

syndrome_features: Agenesis of the corpus callosum, intellectual disability, lower extremity spasticity, adducted thumbs
syndrome_synonyms: Mental retardation, Aphasia, Spastic paraparesis, Adducted thumbs syndrome

syndrome_features: Congenital muscular dystrophy, cobblestone brain malformation, ocular abnormalities
Choanal atresia, cleft palate, maxillary and mandibular hypoplasia, microtia, microcephaly
The three cardinal features of this syndrome are microcephaly, ocular abnormalities (predominantly chorioretinopathy) and variable lower limb lymphedema.
Progressive microcephaly, infant-onset epilepsy including infantile spasms
Unilateral or bilateral microophthalmia and/or anophthalmia and linear skin defects
syndrome_name: Microphthalmia with linear skin defects syndrome
Microcephalic osteodysplastic primordial dwarfism type I

syndrome_features: Severe growth deficiency, abnormal facial features including prominent nose, and malformed ears, high-pitched voice, distinct radiological abnormalities including shortening of middle and distal segments of the limbs, progressive bony dysplasia (cox vara, epiphysiolysis, metaphyseal flaring, V-shaped distal femoral metaphases), absent or mild intellectual disability. Brain imaging findings include dilated intracranial arteries that resemble aneurysms or Moyamoya disease
syndrome_name: Microcephalic osteodysplastic primordial dwarfism type II

syndrome_features: Megalencephaly, with head circumference +3 to +4 SD above the mean, bilateral polymicrogyria, postaxial polydactyly, hydrocephalus
Intellectual disability, seizures, elevated alkaline phosphatase.
Blepharophimosis, micrognathia, distal arthrogryposis, arachnodactyly
Cerebellar ataxia, early-onset cataracts, chronic myopathy, variable intellectual disability and delayed motor development.
Accelerated skeletal maturation, mental retardation, facial dysmorphism (prominent forehead, shallow orbits, blue sclerae, midface hypoplasia, micrognathia).
PDAC stands for Pulmonary aplasia/dysgenesis/hypoplasia, Diaphragmatic eventration/hernia, Anophthalmia/microphthalmia/ocular dysplasia, Cardiac defect
Renal cysts, various abnormalities of the CNS (most often encephalocele), hepatic ductal dysplasia, polydactyly
Loss of milestones, infant-onset epilepsy, hypotonia, failure to thrive, and characteristic hair abnormalities.
Lissencephaly, microcephaly, bitemporal narrowing, vertical furrowing in central forehead, anteverted nares, micrognathia
Dystonia, progressive hearing loss

Microcephaly, mental retardation, cupped ears, hypertelorism, downslanting palprebral fissures, deep-set eyes, prominent nasal tip with long columella, varying absence of the enteric ganglia (Hirschsprung disease)
Progressive microcephaly, intrauterine growth retardation and short stature, recurrent sinopulmonary infections, an increased risk for cancer, and premature ovarian failure in females.

Cafe au lait macules (6 or more greater than 5 mm in prepubertal persons or over 15 mm in postpubertal persons), axillary and/or inguinal freckling, dermal neurofibromas (two or more) or one plexiform neurofibroma, Lisch nodules.
Lethargy, hypotonia, apnea, intractable seizures (classic neonatal form), later-onset seizures, choreoathetosis, mental retardation, vertical gaze palsy (infant-onset and atypical forms)
Childhood-onset, progressive, moderate-to-severe high-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment, without other medical findings
Dense nuclear cataracts, microcornea, abnormal teeth
Severe IUGR, ectodermal dysplasia and edema, malformations of the CNS, limb abnormalities (syndactyly, camptodactyly, flexion contractures, pterygia).
Short stature, congenital heart defects, variable developmental disability
Pseudogliomas of the eye, total blindness, retinopathy, retinal dystrophy
Cystic microphthalmia, periorbital skin appendages, CNS abnormalities, including of the ventricular system.
Median cleft lip, lobulated tongue, bifid tongue, tongue hamartoma, facial asymmetry, frontal bossing, hypertelorism, abnormalities of fingers and toes (clinodactyly, syndactyly, brachydactyly).
Intellectual disability, cryptorchidism, patellar hypoplasia/agenesis
syndrome_synonyms: Genitopatellar Syndrome, Say-Barber-Biesecker Variant of Ohdo Syndrome

syndrome_features: Intellectual disability, agenesis of the corpus callosum
Pontocerebellar hypoplasia, anterior horn cell disease
Pontocerebellar hypoplasia, optic atrophy
Pontocerebellar hypoplasia, elevated CSF lactate, edema
Pontocerebellar hypoplasia, hypogonadism
Episodic ataxia, hypotonia, lactic acidosis, increased blood and CSF pyruvate, some have facial dysmorphology
syndrome_synonyms: Pyruvate decarboxylase deficiency, Pyruvate dehydrogenase E1-Alpha Deficiency, Thiamine-responsive lactic acidosis

syndrome_features: Polyhydramnios, preterm labour and distinctive craniofacial features, megalencephaly, infantile-onset intractable multifocal seizures and severe psychomotor retardation.
syndrome_name: Polyhydramnios, megalencephaly and symptomatic epilepsy syndrome

syndrome_features: A neonatal epileptic encephalopathy that responds to pyridoxal phosphate (PLP), but not pyridoxine
Multiple types of seizures that respond clinically and electrographically to pyridoxine
Coronal craniosynostosis, hypertelorism, proptosis, broad thumbs and great toes, syndactyly of fingers/toes
Autism, intellectual disability, temperature dysregulation, speech delay
Intellectual disability, characteristic facial dysmorphology, episodic breathing rhythm disturbances
Asymmetric overgrowth, connective tissue and epidermal nevi, hyperostoses, ovarian cystadenomas, parotid monomorphic adenoma, dysregulated adipose tissue, vascular malformation
Agenesis of the corpus callosum, mental retardation, seizures, limb abnormalities. Females have spastic quadriplegia. Males have severe micrencephaly.
Hyperphenylalaninemia, intellectual disability, epilepsy, progressive basal ganglia calcification
Renal hypodysplasia and optic nerve coloboma
Abrupt onset of dystonia, bradykinesia, postural instability
Characteristic dysmorphic facial features, broad thumbs and great toes, postnatal microcephaly, intellectual disability

Growth retardation, mental retardation, distinctive facies (including micrognathia, low-set/posteriorly-rotated ears, ptosis, epicanthal folds, hypertelorism), cleft palate, structural cardiac defects, abnormal male genitalia (ie hypospadius), postaxial polydactyly, syndactyly of toes 2-3
syndrome_synonyms: RSH Syndrome (acronym derived from the first 3 families identified with the condition)

syndrome_features: Hypoplasia or agenesis of the septum pellucidum and optic nerve
Upper motor neuron signs, leg spasticity, onset typically before age 20 years, abnormal (thin) corpus callosum
syndrome_synonyms: Complicated hereditary spastic paraplegia, with thin corpus callosum

syndrome_features: 4-hydroxybutyric aciduria, mild-moderate mental retardation, disproportionate language dysfunction, hypotonia, hyporeflexia, autistic behaviors, seizures, and hallucinations.
Sebaceous nevus of the face/scalp
syndrome_synonyms: Nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn, Epidermal nevus syndrome, Linear sebaceous nevus sequence

syndrome_features: Severe intrauterine and postnatal growth deficiency, abnormal facial features (large eyes, beaklike nose, narrow face, receding jaw) and variable intellectual disability. Some affected individuals have various types of myelodysplasia (pancytopenia, acute myeloid leukemia). Brain imaging findings include microcephaly with simplified gyral pattern.
syndrome_synonyms: Bird-headed dwarfism, Nanocephalic dwarfism, Microcephalic primordial dwarfism

syndrome_features: Macrosomia, coarse facies, intellectual disability
Intellectual disability, autism, characteristic facies
Intellectual disability, thin habitus with diminished muscle mass, osteoporosis, kyphoscoliosis, facial dysmorphism (asymmetry, full lower lip), long great toes, and nasal or dysarthric speech.
Overgrowth, learning disability, characteristic facies.
Talipes equinovarus, atrial septal defect (ASD), Robin sequence (micrognathia, glossoptosis, and cleft palate), and persistence of the left superior vena cava
Hypopigmented macules ("ash-leaf spots"), facial angiofibromas, shagreen patches, ungual fibromas, cortical tubers, developmental delay, renal angiomyolipomas, cardiac rhabdomyomas
syndrome_synonyms: Tuberous Sclerosis type 1, Tuberous Sclerosis type 2, Bourneville Disease

syndrome_features: Intellectual disability, epilepsy, and hypoplasia or aplasia of the nails of the thumb and great toe.
Long QT, congenital heart anomalies, hand and foot findings, characteristic dysmorphology, neuropsychiatric features including autism

Congenital muscular dystrophy, congenital contractures (usually at the elbows), severe CNS dysgenesis (cobblestone malformation, pontine hypoplasia, Dandy-Walker malformation), eye malformations (including coarse trabecular meshwork in anterior chamber resulting in glaucoma, progressive retinal atrophy, congenital or juvenile cataracts, microphthalmia, buphthalmus, Peter anomaly)
syndrome_synonyms: HARD Syndrome (Hydrocephalus, Agyria, and Retinal Dysplasia), Cerebroocular dysgenesis, Cerebroocular dysplasia-muscular dystrophy syndrome

syndrome_features: Anophthalmia or microphthalmia, limb abnormalities (syndactyly, oligodactyly, dislocation of the elbows and hips, hypoplastic fibulae), growth failure, intellectual disability
syndrome_synonyms: Microphthalmia with limb anomalies, Ophthalmoacromelic Syndrome

syndrome_features: Microcephaly, microphthalmia, microcornea, congenital cataract, mental retardation, hypogenitalism

Tall stature, variable intellect, dysmorphic facies, associated clinical features including advanced bone age, poor coordination, soft doughy skin, camptodactyly of the fingers or toes, umbilical hernia, abnormal tone, and hoarse low cry in infancy.
Hairy elbows, dysmorphic facial appearances (hypertelorism, thick eyebrows, downslanted and vertically narrow palpebral fissures), pre- and post-natal growth deficiency, intellectual disability
Hypogonadism, alopecia, diabetes mellitus, mental retardation, hearing impairment, and dystonia

Lissencephaly with posterior-anterior gradient (thinner cortex than in classical lissencephaly), agenesis of the corpus callosum, neonatal-onset seizures, ambiguous genitalia (including micropenis, undescended testes, dysgenetic testes)
syndrome_synonyms: X-linked lissencephaly with ambiguous genitalia, XLISG

syndrome_features: Congenital hydrocephalus, agenesis of corpus callosum, intellectual disability, adducted thumbs
Sun sensitivity, ocular involvement, and increased risk of cutaneous neoplasms (basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, melanoma).
Periventricular nodular heterotopia, epilepsy
Dysmorphic facial features (turribrachycephaly, flat round facies, high forehead, abnormal ears), congenital cataracts, hepatomegaly, renal cysts
